ground_truth_answer: Since the 1991 Paris Peace Agreements, Cambodia has experienced mixed progress. While the agreements brought relative stability and enabled free multiparty elections in 1993, democratic freedoms have eroded over time. The Cambodian People's Party (CPP) took power by force in 1997 and won all 125 parliamentary seats in 2018 after dissolving the opposition party. Environmental activists face imprisonment, as seen in the Mother Nature NGO case. Regarding mining activities, they cause significant environmental damage including erosion, loss of biodiversity, contamination of soil and water, and destruction of natural landscapes. Mining operations leave behind huge holes, damage natural beauty, and can create lifeless wastelands when companies don't fulfill their environmental responsibilities.
